title: 107_hr3007
content: The Act may be cited as the "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" and provides small business assistance. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" amends the Small Business Act to provide grants to general aviation small businesses for direct losses incurred due to Federal ground stop orders after September 11, 2001. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" allows for loans to assist general aviation small businesses affected by the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" provides interest-free loans for small businesses impacted by the September 11, 2001 attacks for a 1-year period. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" offers interest-free loans with terms similar to economic injury loans, without affecting existing loan limits or requiring a disaster declaration. The term 'general aviation small business concern' is defined in the Act. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" defines a small business concern as one providing general aviation services, and substantial economic injury as harm leading to financial difficulties in meeting obligations or operating expenses. The Small Business Act is amended to define a small business concern as one providing general aviation services. Appropriations are authorized for the Small Business Administration to carry out the amended section. SEC. 3 of the Act defers payments on Small Business Administration loans for general aviation small businesses for 1 year, with no interest accruing. After the deferral period, regular payments of principal and interest will resume. The term "general aviation small business concern" is defined in the Act. SEC. 4 extends the due date for excise tax deposits. Extension of Due Date for Excise Tax Deposits for general aviation small business concerns under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, allowing timely deposits until November 15, 2001, with possible extensions by the Secretary of the Treasury. The term "airline-related deposit" refers to any deposit of taxes imposed on air transportation under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
